original: rnam par gzhag pa ni 'bras bu che ba khams gsum ro gcig tu 'byung ba'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa ni 'bras bu che ba khams gsum ro gcig tu 'byung ba'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The result is the great one, the nature arising as the same taste in the three realms.

original: de dag gi sngon du 'gro ba'i cho ga dang mjug gi rim pa ni snga ma bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: de dag gi sngon du 'gro ba'i cho ga dang mjug gi rim pa ni snga ma bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: The ritual preliminaries and the concluding stages are to be applied as before.

original: le'u brgyad pa'o /
analyzed: le'u brgyad pa'o /
translated: CHAPTER VIII

original: // / de nas zhes bya ba ni rim pa gnyis kyi don bstan pa'i rjes la'o //
analyzed: // / de nas zhes bya ba ni rim pa gnyis kyi don bstan pa'i rjes la'o //
translated: Then, after the meaning of the two stages has been taught,

original: rnam par dag pa ni gnyis te /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa ni gnyis te /
translated: there are two purities:

original: rang bzhin rnam par dag pa dang / sgyu ma yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin rnam par dag pa dang / sgyu ma yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: natural purity and the purity of illusion.

original: rang bzhin rnam par dag pa ni rnam par dag pa dang mchog tu rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin rnam par dag pa ni rnam par dag pa dang mchog tu rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: Natural purity is twofold: purity and supreme purity.

original: rnam par dag ni chos thams cad skye ba med par spros pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par dag ni chos thams cad skye ba med par spros pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: Purity is the freedom from conceptual elaboration of all phenomena as non-arisen.

original: mchog tu dag pa ni bde ba chen po'i thun mong ma yin pa dag pa'o //
analyzed: mchog tu dag pa ni bde ba chen po'i thun mong ma yin pa dag pa'o //
translated: Supreme purity is the uncommon purity of great bliss.

original: sgyu ma yongs su dag pa ni chos thams cas rmi lam mam sgyu ma lta ba'o //
analyzed: sgyu ma yongs su dag pa ni chos thams cas rmi lam mam sgyu ma lta ba'o //
translated: The purity of illusion is the perception of all phenomena as dreams or illusions.

original: sgyu ma chog tu yongs su dag pa ni lha'i rnal 'byor sgyu ma dang rmi lam la sogs par shes pa'o //
analyzed: sgyu ma chog tu yongs su dag pa ni lha'i rnal 'byor sgyu ma dang rmi lam la sogs par shes pa'o //
translated: The supreme purity of illusion is the knowledge of the illusion-like deity yoga as a dream, etc.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid shes na chos thams cad kyi mdo dang rgyas pa shes par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa dang / gzugs khams zhes bya stong pa ste //
analyzed: gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid shes na chos thams cad kyi mdo dang rgyas pa shes par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa dang / gzugs khams zhes bya stong pa ste //
translated: If one knows the suchness of form, one will know the brief and extensive teachings of all dharmas.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngar gsungs pa dang mtshungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngar gsungs pa dang mtshungs so //
translated: And it says, “The form realm is called empty,” and so on, as stated above.

original: yang gzugs kyang rmi lam lta bu sgyu ma lta bu'o //
analyzed: yang gzugs kyang rmi lam lta bu sgyu ma lta bu'o //
translated: Moreover, form is like a dream, like an illusion.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa yang rmi lam lta bu sgyu @276a * //🔽ma lta bu'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa yang rmi lam lta bu sgyu @276a * // ma lta bu'o //
translated: Nirvāṇa is like a dream, like an illusion.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa las ches lhag pa'i chos cig yod na yang rmi lam lta bu sgyu ma lta bu'o zhes gsungs so //🔽gzhan yang / seng ge zla ba'i grong khyer bzhin //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa las ches lhag pa'i chos cig yod na yang rmi lam lta bu sgyu ma lta bu'o zhes gsungs so // gzhan yang / seng ge zla ba'i grong khyer bzhin //
translated: If there were a dharma superior to nirvāṇa, that too would be like a dream, like an illusion.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher gsungs so //
translated: Moreover, it says, “Like the city of the moon for a lion,” and so on, at length.

original: le'u bshad pa ni sdud par byed pas khas len pa'o //
analyzed: le'u bshad pa ni sdud par byed pas khas len pa'o //
translated: The explanation of the chapter is accepted by the compiler.

original: dngos po thams cad ni brtan g-yo bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad ni brtan g-yo bsdus pa'o //
translated: All things are included in the animate and inanimate.

original: dag pa ni tha mal pa'i rang bzhin dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: dag pa ni tha mal pa'i rang bzhin dang bral ba'o //
translated: Pure means free from the nature of the ordinary.

original: de bzhin nyid ni ma bcos pa ste rang bzhin rnam dag gis bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ni ma bcos pa ste rang bzhin rnam dag gis bstan pa'o //
translated: Suchness is unfabricated, taught by natural purity.

original: phyi nas zhes bya ba ni le'u brgyad par ni bskyed pa'i sngon du bstan la /
analyzed: phyi nas zhes bya ba ni le'u brgyad par ni bskyed pa'i sngon du bstan la /
translated: Later means that in the eighth chapter, creation is taught first,

original: 'dir ni de las bzlog pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dir ni de las bzlog pa bstan to //
translated: and here, the reverse of that is taught.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: der ni rten dang brten pa'i dbang du byas te /
analyzed: der ni rten dang brten pa'i dbang du byas te /
translated: There, in terms of the support and the supported,

original: rten sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: the support precedes.

original: 'dir ni de kho na nyid kyi dbang du byas te /
analyzed: 'dir ni de kho na nyid kyi dbang du byas te /
translated: Here, in terms of reality,

original: rang bzhin rnam par dag pas khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin rnam par dag pas khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it is pervaded by natural purity.

original: re re'i dbye ba ni chos re re la yod pa'i lha'o //
analyzed: re re'i dbye ba ni chos re re la yod pa'i lha'o //
translated: The individual deities are the deities that exist in each of the phenomena.

original: lha rnams kyi brjod pa ni rten dri za'i grong khyer dang / brten pa rmi lam lta bu dang / longs spyod sgyu ma lta bu ste /
analyzed: lha rnams kyi brjod pa ni rten dri za'i grong khyer dang / brten pa rmi lam lta bu dang / longs spyod sgyu ma lta bu ste /
translated: The expression of the deities is the supported, like a gandharva city, and the enjoyment is like an illusion.

original: sgyu ma rnam dag tu bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sgyu ma rnam dag tu bstan pa'o //
translated: It is taught to be pure illusion.

original: 'di rnams phyogs gcig tu bstan pa ni rgyud zor yang pa'i dgos pa dang / bdag med pa dang he ru ka gnyis khyad par med par bstan pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'di rnams phyogs gcig tu bstan pa ni rgyud zor yang pa'i dgos pa dang / bdag med pa dang he ru ka gnyis khyad par med par bstan pa'i don to //
translated: The purpose of teaching these together is to show that there is no difference between Nairātmya and Heruka.

original: da ni rang bzhin rnam dag bshad pa /
analyzed: da ni rang bzhin rnam dag bshad pa /
translated: Now, the explanation of the naturally pure:

original: gang la dag pa'i tshig rkang gnyis kyis bstan pa ste go sla'o //
analyzed: gang la dag pa'i tshig rkang gnyis kyis bstan pa ste go sla'o //
translated: The two lines “pure from the beginning” are easy to understand.

original: gang ltar dag pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i tshig rkang gnyis dang rang bzhin gyis dag pa'i tshig rkang gcig ste go sla'o //
analyzed: gang ltar dag pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i tshig rkang gnyis dang rang bzhin gyis dag pa'i tshig rkang gcig ste go sla'o //
translated: As for how it is pure, the two lines “form” and so on and the one line “naturally pure” are easy to understand.

original: gang dag pa ni nyon mongs shes bya'i sgrib pa'o //
analyzed: gang dag pa ni nyon mongs shes bya'i sgrib pa'o //
translated: What is pure is the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience.

original: gang gis dag pa ni dag byed gzhan la mi ltos pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis dag pa ni dag byed gzhan la mi ltos pa'o //
translated: By what is it pure? It is pure by not relying on another purifier.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na ;
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na ;
translated: Why is that?

original: / dag pa gzhan gyis rnam grol min //
analyzed: / dag pa gzhan gyis rnam grol min //
translated: “Liberation is not by another purity.”

original: zhes pa ni dam bca' ba'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni dam bca' ba'o //
translated: This is the thesis.

original: yul rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin ni de sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: yul rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin ni de sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: The nature of the pure object is the proof of that.

original: rang rig bde mchog ni sgrub pa'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: rang rig bde mchog ni sgrub pa'i khyad par ro //
translated: “Self-awareness is supreme” is the special proof.

original: gzung ba med pa'i phyir 'dzin pa med do //
analyzed: gzung ba med pa'i phyir 'dzin pa med do //
translated: Because there is no object, there is no subject.

original: de ltar med pas rang bzhin bde ba mchog go //🔽yang 'dir kha cig dag pa dag par byed dam /
analyzed: de ltar med pas rang bzhin bde ba mchog go // yang 'dir kha cig dag pa dag par byed dam /
translated: Since it is so, it is the supreme bliss of the natural state.🔽Now, here, some think, “Is the pure made pure?

original: ma dag pa dag par byed ces rtog pa la /
analyzed: ma dag pa dag par byed ces rtog pa la /
translated: Or is the impure made pure?”

original: de yang le'u brgyad pa'i skabs su bshad pa ltar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang le'u brgyad pa'i skabs su bshad pa ltar shes par bya'o //
translated: That should be understood as explained in the context of chapter 8.

analyzed: da ni sdud par byed pas 'gro ba sangs rgyas kyi bdag nyid rang bzhin gyis dag pa la the tshom gyis 'dri ba dang lan tshigs su bcad pa phyed @276b dang bzhis ston te go sla'o //
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate the reply to the question of the compiler, who doubts that migrating beings are of the nature of the buddhas and naturally pure, the reply is given in two and a half verses, which is easy to understand.

original: da ni nyams su blang ba'i thabs bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni nyams su blang ba'i thabs bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate the method of practice,

original: dag pa zhes pa ni rang bzhin rnam pa dag gis so //
analyzed: dag pa zhes pa ni rang bzhin rnam pa dag gis so //

analyzed: dug med byas ni lta ba'i dpe ste bsgom pa la sogs pa'i dpe yang ji ltar me yis tshig pa la sogs te brtag pa phyi ma la'o //

analyzed: bsten bya 'di ni dpe don te 'dod pa'i yon tan no //
translated: “This object of reliance” is the example and meaning of the objects of desire.

analyzed: bsten pa nyid ni phyag rgya chen po dang gar byed pa'i thabs su'o //
translated: The reliance itself is the means of the great seal and the dance.

original: da ni sgyu ma'i rnam dag bshad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni sgyu ma'i rnam dag bshad pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to explain the purity of illusion,

analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga ni go sla'o //

analyzed: 'di dag rnam dag ni lha ru 'gyur ba tsam mo //

original: 'di nyid rnal 'byor ni sgyu ma dag pa'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid rnal 'byor ni sgyu ma dag pa'o //

analyzed: gnas la ni rang bzhin 'gyur ba'o //

analyzed: 'o na de nyid dag pa ji lta bu zhe na /

analyzed: de bstan pa'i phyir brtag pa phyi ma'i lha'i dag pa bstan te go sla'o //
translated: In order to teach that, the purity of the deity of the subsequent analysis is taught, which is easy to understand.

analyzed: pukka s'i la sogs pa'i gnas bshad nas dag pa ji lta bu zhe nas la sogs pa de go sla'o //

translated: The side of the stage of generation is the system of that.

original: zhe sdang la sogs pa spyod pa ni bshad ma thag pa'o //
analyzed: zhe sdang la sogs pa spyod pa ni bshad ma thag pa'o //
translated: The conduct of hatred and so forth is as just explained.

original: 'dis ni phung po sbyang ba ni rnam grangs gzhan du bstan pa sngar bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni phung po sbyang ba ni rnam grangs gzhan du bstan pa sngar bzhin no //
translated: This teaches the purification of the aggregates in another way, as before.

original: da ni mjug bsdu ba'i phyir gang dang gang gis bya ba ni phung po dang nyon mongs pa la sogs pa de nyid do //
analyzed: da ni mjug bsdu ba'i phyir gang dang gang gis bya ba ni phung po dang nyon mongs pa la sogs pa de nyid do //
translated: Now, in order to conclude, the “what” and “by what” are the aggregates, afflictions, and so on.

original: 'jig rten ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i de kho na nyid mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i de kho na nyid mi shes pa'o //
translated: The “world” is those who do not know the reality of the completion stage.

original: bcing pa ni ;'khor ba'o //
analyzed: bcing pa ni ;'khor ba'o //
translated: “Bondage” is saṃsāra.

original: de dang des ni phung po la sogs pa de nyid do //
analyzed: de dang des ni phung po la sogs pa de nyid do //
translated: “By that” is the aggregates, and so on.

original: grol ba ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: grol ba ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa rtogs pa'o //
translated: “Liberation” is the realization of the completion stage.

original: de nyid mi shes ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid mi shes ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: “Not knowing that” is the completion stage.

original: 'jig rten mi grol ba ni grub pa'i mtha' la ma zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten mi grol ba ni grub pa'i mtha' la ma zhugs pa'o //
translated: “The world is not liberated” is not entering into the conclusion.

original: de nyid rnam spang ni grub pa'i mtha' ngan pas bsgyur ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid rnam spang ni grub pa'i mtha' ngan pas bsgyur ba'o //
translated: “Abandoning that” is being turned by bad conclusions.

original: dngos grub mi rnyed pa ni bskal pa du mas phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub mi 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: dngos grub mi rnyed pa ni bskal pa du mas phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub mi 'grub pa'o //
translated: “Not attaining power” is not accomplishing the power of the great seal through many eons.

original: de'i phyir de dag las bzlog ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag las bzlog ste /
translated: Therefore, the opposite of those is

original: dri med sgra med la sogs pa rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i de kho na nyid spros pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: dri med sgra med la sogs pa rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i de kho na nyid spros pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: “stainless,” “soundless,” and so on, which is the reality of the completion stage free from proliferation.

original: tha mal pa dang grub mtha' ngan pas bsgyur ba med pa'o ;
analyzed: tha mal pa dang grub mtha' ngan pas bsgyur ba med pa'o ;
translated: It is not changed by ordinary people or by those who have fallen into bad philosophical views.

original: / thams cad rnam par dag pa ni rang bzhin rnam par dag tu'o //
analyzed: / thams cad rnam par dag pa ni rang bzhin rnam par dag tu'o //
translated: Everything is pure, in the purity of nature.

original: rang bzhin dag pas grol ba grol bar shes zhes so //
analyzed: rang bzhin dag pas grol ba grol bar shes zhes so //
translated: Liberation is known as liberation through the purity of nature.

original: yang gang dang gang gis zhes bya ba ni snga ma dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: yang gang dang gang gis zhes bya ba ni snga ma dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: Again, “whatever and by whatever” is as before.

original: de dang des ni bcing ba ni btags pa'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: de dang des ni bcing ba ni btags pa'i dngos po'o //
translated: “Bound by that and by that” is the imagined thing.

original: des ngan song du 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: des ngan song du 'gro ba'o //
translated: By that, one goes to the lower realms.

original: grol ba ni @277b lha'i rnal 'byor du byas pa ste /
analyzed: grol ba ni @277b lha'i rnal 'byor du byas pa ste /
translated: Liberation is the performance of divine yoga.

original: de nyid mi shes 'jig rten ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de nyid mi shes 'jig rten ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The world does not know that, as before.

original: mi grol ba ni lha'i rnal 'byor mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: mi grol ba ni lha'i rnal 'byor mi shes pa'o //
translated: Nonliberation is the nonknowledge of divine yoga.

original: de nyid rnam spangs ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i grub mtha' la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid rnam spangs ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i grub mtha' la sogs pa'o //
translated: The abandonment of that is the philosophy of the perfections, and so on.

original: dngos grub mi rnyed ni thun mong gi dngos grub rnams so //
analyzed: dngos grub mi rnyed ni thun mong gi dngos grub rnams so //
translated: The nonattainment of power is the common powers.

original: de'i phyir dri med ces bya ba la sogs pa sbyar te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dri med ces bya ba la sogs pa sbyar te /
translated: Therefore, “stainless,” and so on, is applied.

original: lha'i rnam par mos pa'o //
analyzed: lha'i rnam par mos pa'o //
translated: The imagination of the form of the deity.

original: thams cad rnam par dag ces pa ni sgyu ma yongs su dag pa ste /
analyzed: thams cad rnam par dag ces pa ni sgyu ma yongs su dag pa ste /
translated: All is pure is the complete purity of illusion.

original: de yongs su shes pas 'gro ba grol bar shes pa'o //
analyzed: de yongs su shes pas 'gro ba grol bar shes pa'o //
translated: By knowing that, one knows that beings are liberated.

original: le'u dgu pa'o /
analyzed: le'u dgu pa'o /
translated: CHAPTER 9

original: // / de nas ni bdag don dag pa dang ldan pa'i rjes la /
analyzed: // / de nas ni bdag don dag pa dang ldan pa'i rjes la /
translated: Now, after the purity of one's own purpose,

original: gzhan don bstan pa'i phyir ji ltar dkyil 'khor zhes pa ni rdul tshon no //
analyzed: gzhan don bstan pa'i phyir ji ltar dkyil 'khor zhes pa ni rdul tshon no //
translated: in order to teach the purpose of others, it is said, the maṇḍala, which is the colored powders.

original: rim pa zhes pa ni sa'i cha dbye ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rim pa zhes pa ni sa'i cha dbye ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The stages are the divisions of the ground, and so on.

original: yang dag bshad ni sdud par byed pa khas len pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag bshad ni sdud par byed pa khas len pa ste /
translated: Having explained, one should accept the compiler.

original: ma nor pa'am gzhan don yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma nor pa'am gzhan don yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is unerring or for the benefit of others.

original: yang gang gis zhes pa ni ji lta ba bzhin te de kho na dris pa'o //
analyzed: yang gang gis zhes pa ni ji lta ba bzhin te de kho na dris pa'o //
translated: Again, by whom is how, that is, that is the question.

original: slob ma ni dam tshig dang sdom par ldan pa'o //
analyzed: slob ma ni dam tshig dang sdom par ldan pa'o //
translated: The disciples are endowed with samaya and vows.

original: dbang bskur ba ni rgyud brlan par byed cing 'khru ba ste zhing sa chus brlan pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dbang bskur ba ni rgyud brlan par byed cing 'khru ba ste zhing sa chus brlan pa lta bu'o //
translated: The empowerment is the moistening and washing of the continuum, like a field moistened with water.

original: cho ga ni thabs kyi rim pa'o //
analyzed: cho ga ni thabs kyi rim pa'o //
translated: The rite is the process of the method.🔽

original: rab tu bshad pa ni yang dag pa las bstan pa ste sdud par byed pa khas len pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu bshad pa ni yang dag pa las bstan pa ste sdud par byed pa khas len pa'o //
translated: The explanation is the teaching of the truth, the acceptance of the compiler.

original: de'i rim pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: de'i rim pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is the sequence of those?

original: de dag gi go rims kyang bla ma la rag las par bya ba'i phyir dkrugs nas bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi go rims kyang bla ma la rag las par bya ba'i phyir dkrugs nas bstan pa'o //
translated: The sequence of those is taught in a mixed way in order to depend on the guru.

original: de yang dang po gnas bstan pa'i phyir tshal ni nags sam skyed shing gi ra ba'o //
analyzed: de yang dang po gnas bstan pa'i phyir tshal ni nags sam skyed shing gi ra ba'o //
translated: Moreover, first, in order to show the place, the forest is a grove or a garden.

original: dben pa ni tshal de nyid la bya ba'am dgon pa'am bas mtha'o //
analyzed: dben pa ni tshal de nyid la bya ba'am dgon pa'am bas mtha'o //
translated: Solitude is either in that very forest, or in a wilderness or a border region.

original: yang na skye bo mi 'du ba gang yang rung ba'o //
analyzed: yang na skye bo mi 'du ba gang yang rung ba'o //
translated: Or it is any place where people do not gather.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i khyim ni rnal 'byor pa'am rgyal po la sogs pa snying rje dang ldan pa'o ;
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i khyim ni rnal 'byor pa'am rgyal po la sogs pa snying rje dang ldan pa'o ;
translated: The house of the bodhisattva is a yogi or a king, etc., who has compassion.

original: / yang gtsug lag khang ste po ti glegs bam gnas pa'o //
analyzed: / yang gtsug lag khang ste po ti glegs bam gnas pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the temple is the place where the books are kept.

original: de'i bdag po byang chub sems dpa' yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i bdag po byang chub sems dpa' yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the bodhisattva is the lord of that.

original: dkyil 'khor khang pa ni sgrub pa'i gnas sam lha khang ngo //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor khang pa ni sgrub pa'i gnas sam lha khang ngo //
translated: The mandala house is the place of practice or the temple.

original: dkyil 'khor bzhengs pa ni bsnyen pa dang 'brel pa'i tshe mandalaa bri ba dang dam tshig bsgom pa yin la /🔽sgrub pa 'phel ba'i tshe dkyil 'khor khang pa yang tshal la sogs pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor bzhengs pa ni bsnyen pa dang 'brel pa'i tshe mandalaa bri ba dang dam tshig bsgom pa yin la / sgrub pa 'phel ba'i tshe dkyil 'khor khang pa yang tshal la sogs pa dang ldan pa /
translated: The construction of the mandala is the drawing of the mandala and the cultivation of the commitments when one is connected with the approach.🔽When one is connected with the development of the accomplishment, one should construct a house of the mandala, endowed with a garden, etc.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi don du khang pa brtsigs pa dang dkyil 'khor mchog ni bri ba'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi don du khang pa brtsigs pa dang dkyil 'khor mchog ni bri ba'o //
translated: The supreme mandala is the drawing of the mandala.

original: de'i rjes la /🔽'khor lo'i bdag po'i bzlas pa 'bum //
analyzed: de'i rjes la / 'khor lo'i bdag po'i bzlas pa 'bum //
translated: After that,🔽the recitation of the lord of the mandala is one hundred thousand.

original: dkyil 'khor ba yi de bzhin khri //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor ba yi de bzhin khri //
translated: The recitation of the mandala deities is ten thousand.

original: zhes bya ba ni slob mas lan gnyis lan @278a * //🔽gsum gyi bar du gsol ba gdab pa dang / bsnyen pa bya ste bdag med ma'i le'u brgyad pa ltar rdzogs par bsgoms la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni slob mas lan gnyis lan @278a * // gsum gyi bar du gsol ba gdab pa dang / bsnyen pa bya ste bdag med ma'i le'u brgyad pa ltar rdzogs par bsgoms la /
translated: The disciple should supplicate two or three times, and perform the approach.

original: mchod bstod bdud rtsi myang ba dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa cung zad bsgom //
analyzed: mchod bstod bdud rtsi myang ba dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa cung zad bsgom //
translated: One should cultivate the perfection stage a little.

original: zla ba dang chu zla lta bu'i bsam gtan gyi sgra brnyan dang brag ca lta bu'i bzlas pa bya ste ;
analyzed: zla ba dang chu zla lta bu'i bsam gtan gyi sgra brnyan dang brag ca lta bu'i bzlas pa bya ste ;
translated: One should perform the recitation like the moon and the reflection of the moon, like an echo in meditation, like an echo.

original: / aom aa a'a: h'um phat sv'a h'a zhes pa rim pa kun la sbyar ba ni rim gyis pa'o //
analyzed: / aom aa a'a: h'um phat sv'a h'a zhes pa rim pa kun la sbyar ba ni rim gyis pa'o //
translated: Oṃ a ā / oṃ aḥ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā is applied in all the stages.

original: cig car ba ni aom aa a'a: zhes pa la sogs pa zangs kyis sbyar te h'um phat sv'a h'a zhes sbyar la bdag med ma la 'bum gzhan la khri khri bya'o //
analyzed: cig car ba ni aom aa a'a: zhes pa la sogs pa zangs kyis sbyar te h'um phat sv'a h'a zhes sbyar la bdag med ma la 'bum gzhan la khri khri bya'o //
translated: The instantaneous [approach] is to apply the vowels a ā and so forth with the copper [letters] and to apply hūṃ phaṭ svāhā. One should do one hundred thousand [approaches] for Nairātmya and ten thousand for each of the others.

original: dgyes pa'i rdo rje la ni gong du bstan pa dang / 'og nas 'chad pa dang ; / kun la sbyor ba gsum mam yang lag lag drug gi rnal 'byor byas la /
analyzed: dgyes pa'i rdo rje la ni gong du bstan pa dang / 'og nas 'chad pa dang ; / kun la sbyor ba gsum mam yang lag lag drug gi rnal 'byor byas la /
translated: In Hevajra, one should perform the yoga of the three or six limbs as previously explained, as will be explained, and as applied to all [deities].

original: de wa pi tsu'am aasht'a na na 'bum /
analyzed: de wa pi tsu'am aasht'a na na 'bum /
translated: One should do one hundred thousand of deva picu aṣṭānana.

original: bdag med ma la yang /🔽aom badzra nee r'atma aom a'a: h'um zhes khri /
analyzed: bdag med ma la yang / aom badzra nee r'atma aom a'a: h'um zhes khri /
translated: Also for Nairātmya,🔽one should do ten thousand of oṃ vajra nairātma oṃ aḥ hūṃ.

original: aom badzra goo r'i aom a'a: h'um zhes pa kun la khri khri'o //
analyzed: aom badzra goo r'i aom a'a: h'um zhes pa kun la khri khri'o //
translated: For all [deities], one should do ten thousand of oṃ vajra gaurī oṃ aḥ hūṃ.

original: grangs kyi bsnyen pa bskyal po //
analyzed: grangs kyi bsnyen pa bskyal po //
translated: This is the approach by number.

original: mtshan ma'i bsten pa 'og nas rab mthong sngags kyi pha rol son pa ste rab zhal mthong ba dang / lung bstan pa dang / rmi lam gyi mtshan ma ma byung bar du bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma'i bsten pa 'og nas rab mthong sngags kyi pha rol son pa ste rab zhal mthong ba dang / lung bstan pa dang / rmi lam gyi mtshan ma ma byung bar du bya'o //
translated: The “sign of reliance” is the lower [nose tip], and the “upper” is the eyes.

original: dus kyi bsnyen pa 'og nas zla drug goms zhes pa zla drug gam lo'am /
analyzed: dus kyi bsnyen pa 'og nas zla drug goms zhes pa zla drug gam lo'am /
translated: The “time of reliance” is the six months below, as it is said, “one should practice for six months or a year.”

original: zla ba gcig gam tha ma tshad du phyin pa'i bar du bya'o //
analyzed: zla ba gcig gam tha ma tshad du phyin pa'i bar du bya'o //
translated: Or one month, or until the end of the final [repetition].

original: de nas dkyil 'khor bri bar gsol ba gdab pa'i rjes la bsgrub pa bstan pa'i phyir bdag nyid rnal 'byor pa'o //
analyzed: de nas dkyil 'khor bri bar gsol ba gdab pa'i rjes la bsgrub pa bstan pa'i phyir bdag nyid rnal 'byor pa'o //
translated: Then, after the supplication to draw the maṇḍala, in order to explain the practice, “the practitioner” is the yogi.

original: dang po'i la ni mchog gi lha ste rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: dang po'i la ni mchog gi lha ste rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The “first” is the supreme deity, Vajradhara.

original: h'um las rdo rje can dgyes pa'i rdo rje byas te nong sbyang bar 'brel te /
analyzed: h'um las rdo rje can dgyes pa'i rdo rje byas te nong sbyang bar 'brel te /
translated: Having made the vajra from hūṃ, the “vajra holder” is Hevajra.

original: sa'i mtshan nyid brtag pa yang bya'o //
analyzed: sa'i mtshan nyid brtag pa yang bya'o //
translated: The “examination” is also the examination of the characteristics of the ground.

original: phyi nas dkyil 'khor bri ba ni de dag gi rjes la khas len pa'o //
analyzed: phyi nas dkyil 'khor bri ba ni de dag gi rjes la khas len pa'o //
translated: “Drawing the maṇḍala” is the promise after that.

original: de'i rjes la gang gis sbyang zhe na /
analyzed: de'i rjes la gang gis sbyang zhe na /
translated: After that, by what is it purified?

original: gong du gsungs pa'i sngags zhes pa ni /
analyzed: gong du gsungs pa'i sngags zhes pa ni /
translated: The mantra mentioned above is

original: aom raksha la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: aom raksha la sogs pa'o //
translated: Om rakṣa and so forth.

original: mkhas pas 'dzin pa sbyang ba ni phyag rgya dang ting nge 'dzin la mkhas pas kyang ngo //
analyzed: mkhas pas 'dzin pa sbyang ba ni phyag rgya dang ting nge 'dzin la mkhas pas kyang ngo //
translated: The wise should purify the site with the mantra, and also with the wisdom of the mudra and samadhi.

original: gong gi sngags ni zang zing gi sbyin pas rgyud tshim pa brtag pa phyi ma ltar byas la /
analyzed: gong gi sngags ni zang zing gi sbyin pas rgyud tshim pa brtag pa phyi ma ltar byas la /
translated: The mantra above is to examine whether the mindstream is satisfied with the gift of material things.

original: aa k'a ro mu kham la sogs pas chos kyi sbyin pas rgyud dag par byas pas so //
analyzed: aa k'a ro mu kham la sogs pas chos kyi sbyin pas rgyud dag par byas pas so //
translated: The mantra A kāro mukha and so forth is to purify the mindstream with the gift of Dharma.

original: de la gtor ma sbyin pa ni /
analyzed: de la gtor ma sbyin pa ni /
translated: The offering of the torma

original: phyogs skyong gi bdag po bkug ste khyad par du sa'i bdag po la gtor ma dang gter yang gzhug pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs skyong gi bdag po bkug ste khyad par du sa'i bdag po la gtor ma dang gter yang gzhug pa'o //
translated: is to summon the lords of the directions and in particular to offer the torma and treasure to the lord of the site.

original: de'i don ni 'di yin te /🔽dang po rnam bcad sa gzhi @278b bzung //
analyzed: de'i don ni 'di yin te / dang po rnam bcad sa gzhi @278b bzung //
translated: The meaning of that is as follows.🔽First, the site is determined.

original: gnyis pa sta gon gnas par bya //
analyzed: gnyis pa sta gon gnas par bya //
translated: Second, one should perform the preparatory rite.

original: nub gsum pa la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: nub gsum pa la 'jug pa'o //
translated: Third, one should enter.

original: zhes gsungs pas dang po sa'i chog ni don rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pas dang po sa'i chog ni don rnam pa drug ste /
translated: Thus, it is said. The first, the rite of the site, has six topics.

original: sa brtag pa dang / sa bslang ba dang / sa sbyang ba dang / byin gyis brlab pa dang / gzung ba dang / bsrung ba'o //
analyzed: sa brtag pa dang / sa bslang ba dang / sa sbyang ba dang / byin gyis brlab pa dang / gzung ba dang / bsrung ba'o //
translated: The examination of the site, the taking of the site, the purification of the site, the consecration, the taking possession, and the protection.

original: de las brtag pa ni phyi'i brtag pa dang ; / nang gi brtag pa'o //
analyzed: de las brtag pa ni phyi'i brtag pa dang ; / nang gi brtag pa'o //
translated: Of these, the examination is the external examination and the internal examination.

original: de la phyi'i gnas la brtag pa ni gong gi /
analyzed: de la phyi'i gnas la brtag pa ni gong gi /
translated: Of these, the external examination of the site is connected with the above passage:

original: tshal dang skye bo mi gnas dang // zhes par 'brel lo //
analyzed: tshal dang skye bo mi gnas dang // zhes par 'brel lo //
translated: In a forest, in a place uninhabited by people,

original: phyogs la brtag pa ni de rnams kyi byang dang shar gyi phyogs su'o //
analyzed: phyogs la brtag pa ni de rnams kyi byang dang shar gyi phyogs su'o //
translated: The examination of the direction is in the north and east of those.

original: kha dog dang dbyibs las brtag pa ni /
analyzed: kha dog dang dbyibs las brtag pa ni /
translated: The examination of color and shape is

original: au dumw'a ra n+ya gro dha //🔽aa shvattha dad pa la sha /
analyzed: au dumw'a ra n+ya gro dha // aa shvattha dad pa la sha /
translated: The Udumbara, the Nyagrodha,🔽The Ashvattha, the Plakṣa, the Aśoka,

original: ba ku la dang aa rdzu nar ;
analyzed: ba ku la dang aa rdzu nar ;
translated: And the Arjuna,

original: / bcas pas rus sbal rgyab 'dra bar //
analyzed: / bcas pas rus sbal rgyab 'dra bar //
translated: The site should be avoided if it resembles a tortoise back.

original: sa ni drug po spang bar bya //
analyzed: sa ni drug po spang bar bya //
translated: The six sites are to be avoided.

original: zhes gsungs pa tsha sgo can la sogs pa dang / ro khung du chu song ba 'dra ba la sogs pa mtshan ma ngan pa rnams spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa tsha sgo can la sogs pa dang / ro khung du chu song ba 'dra ba la sogs pa mtshan ma ngan pa rnams spang bar bya'o //
translated: The bad signs such as salty and the like, and like water flowing into a cave, are to be avoided.

original: nang gi brtag pa ni bde bar gshegs pa la mchod pa byas la gtor ma btang ste /
analyzed: nang gi brtag pa ni bde bar gshegs pa la mchod pa byas la gtor ma btang ste /
translated: The inner examination is as follows: Having made offerings to the Sugatas, offer a sacrificial cake.

original: lhag pa'i lha'i rnal 'byor tsam gyis nyal bar bya'o //
analyzed: lhag pa'i lha'i rnal 'byor tsam gyis nyal bar bya'o //
translated: One should go to sleep with just the yoga of the special deity.

original: de la rmi lam gyi mtshan ma ngan na gzhan du 'pho'o //
analyzed: de la rmi lam gyi mtshan ma ngan na gzhan du 'pho'o //
translated: If the signs in the dream are bad, one should transfer elsewhere.

original: bzang na de nyid du bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: bzang na de nyid du bri bar bya'o //
translated: If they are good, one should draw there itself.

original: bslang ba la gnyis te /
analyzed: bslang ba la gnyis te /
translated: The second, the request, is twofold:

original: mngon pa la bslang ba dang / mi mngon pa la bslang ba'o //
analyzed: mngon pa la bslang ba dang / mi mngon pa la bslang ba'o //

translated: garudas, kinnaras, vidyadharas, and so forth, old men and old women, together with your retinues and servants, do not stay here, go elsewhere! Having heard the command of Vajrapani, leave quickly! Whoever does not leave
